intro: Graphardisia oxyphylla, commonly known as the red-flowered tamarack, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its slender, dioecious stems and small, clustered leaves. Its most striking feature is its bright red flowers, which bloom in spring and attract pollinators such as bees and birds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
